definition: drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: At his instigation , the water carriers deliberately delayed their delivery by two days.
sentences.chinese: 在他的鼓动下，他们故意比规定的日期迟了两天献水。

sentences.english: He was a motivational speaker, and vice president of a large company.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位富于鼓动性的演说家，一家大公司的副总裁。

sentences.english: Another is the anti-North Korea emotion whipped up here over the abductee issue.
sentences.chinese: 此外，就是绑架事件鼓动起来的反朝情绪。

sentences.english: In fire there is the spark of chaos and destruction, the seed of life.
sentences.chinese: 火焰蕴含着浑沌与毁灭的鼓动，以及生命的种子。

sentences.english: The delayed player delegine stay on the playground.
sentences.chinese: 被耽延的运鼓动代表团停留在操场上。

sentences.english: The speaker incited the mob to demonstrate against the rising cost of living.
sentences.chinese: 演说者鼓动群众示威游行，抗议生活费高涨。

sentences.english: He was accused of stirring up the thralls against their masters.
sentences.chinese: 有人指责他鼓动奴隶反抗主人。

sentences.english: Chances are someone has used one of the techniques below on you.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，有些人使用了以下的某种技巧来鼓动你。

sentences.english: She hesitates at first. But he pushes ’til she agrees.
sentences.chinese: 她起初还有点犹豫，但他不停的鼓动，直到她答应。

sentences.english: David peppered the audience with an anti-inflation speech.
sentences.chinese: 大卫做反通货膨胀的演说鼓动听众。

sentences.english: Advertisements and social cues bombard consumers to eat.
sentences.chinese: 广告和社会暗示鼓动消费者吃了又吃。

sentences.english: Tom instigated a quarrel between Jim and Joe.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆鼓动吉姆和乔伊吵架。

sentences.english: And so on, has great call to action.
He was spirited up against his boss.
sentences.chinese: 他被鼓动得与他的老板作对。

sentences.english: You love rabble-rousing, and you love to bust systems open.
sentences.chinese: 你们爱搅和鼓动，而且你们爱打开爆裂的系统。

sentences.english: These designs fuel demand and propel brand loyalty.
sentences.chinese: 这些设计鼓动需求并推进品牌忠诚度。

definition: to instigate/to incite/to egg sb on
to lobby/to campaign/to promote (an idea, a product)/(old) to visit various rulers and promote one's political ideas (in the Warring States period)
lit. a tongue like a reed (idiom)/fig. a glib tongue
to urge/to prompt/to spur on/to order sb about
to begin to stir (idiom)/to get restless/to become threatening
